alert.note: Alert for Bates; Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 28 at 9:59PM CDT until June 01 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri... Little Osage River near Horton affecting Vernon County. Osage River near Schell City affecting Vernon and Bates Counties. Osage River at Taberville affecting St. Clair County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following river in Missouri... Marmaton River near Nevada affecting Vernon County. For the Little Osage River Basin...including Fulton, Horton...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Osage River Basin...including Schell City, Taberville... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Osage River near Schell City. * WHEN...Until Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 31.5 feet, the main road of the Schell Osage Conservation Area floods west of the conservation office. The north campground main road of the Schell Osage Conservation area floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 31.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 PM CDT Saturday was 31.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 31.5 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 30.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 31.5 feet on 12/17/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. this evening at 1100 PM CDT.
